text: <https://www.zurich.ibm.com/dccl/papers/renesse_dccl.pdf>
<@U0ZJZBJLF>: is our gossip implementation refer to this paper?
Would raft be a potential fit for consensus between peers?
<https://raft.github.io/raft.pdf>

<@U24J6JYVC>  - if your only requirement is crash fault tolerance and not byzantine fault tolerance than you could use Raft.  There is also BFT Raft:    <http://www.scs.stanford.edu/14au-cs244b/labs/projects/copeland_zhong.pdf>   - and there is at least one public implementation of it
<@U0PB67X4K> Thanks...will have a read

<@U12452RAP>  
My team is implementing a gossip implementation that disseminates messages from the consensus service to the rest of the peers. 
It has nothing to do with the paper you quoted.
<@U0ZJZBJLF> is there a specification for this gossip implementation you guys are working on?
yeah, the spec is a WIP itself though. <@U24M29R4G> .
maybe it's a good time to upload the latest changes
<https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-170>
<@U0ZJZBJLF> thanks.. will read
i see a pdf and an powerpoint attached in FAB-170
a ppt*
yep. The ppt is very high level, the pdf is a more low level. the markdown is the same as the pdf, so some day it'll go to github
oh ok.. got it! i am sure it must be an evolving document
if you have constructive comments, you can PM me
sure thing
